interface.name: cx.ring.Ring.ConfigurationManager
interface.tp:docstring: Used to handle the configuration stuff: accounts settings, user preferences, ... TODO: move runtime account stuff in accountmanager

method.name: getAccountDetails
method.tp:docstring: Get all parameters of the specified account.

arg.name: details
arg.tp:docstring:
The available keys / parameters are:
CONFIG_ACCOUNT_ENABLE: True or False (Default: True)
CONFIG_ACCOUNT_RESOLVE_ONCE
CONFIG_ACCOUNT_TYPE: SIP or RING
HOSTNAME: The IP address or hostname of the registrar
USERNAME: The username (or extension) of the account
PASSWORD: The password associated to the account
REALM
CONFIG_ACCOUNT_MAILBOX: Number to dial to access the voicemail box
CONFIG_ACCOUNT_REGISTRATION_EXPIRE: SIP header expiration value (Default: 1600)
BIND_ADDRESS: Custom bind SIP ip address
LOCAL_INTERFACE: The network interface (Default: eth0)
PUBLISHED_SAMEAS_LOCAL: If False, the published address equals the local address. This is the default.
PUBLISHED_ADDRESS: The SIP published address
LOCAL_PORT: The SIP listening port (Default: 5060)
PUBLISHED_PORT: The SIP published port
DISPLAY_NAMEL: The display name
STUN_ENABLE: True or False (Default: False)
STUN_SERVER: The STUN server address
ACCOUNT_REGISTRATION_STATUS: The account registration status. Should be Registered to make calls.
ACCOUNT_REGISTRATION_STATE_CODE
ACCOUNT_REGISTRATION_STATE_DESC
CONFIG_DEFAULT_PRESENCE_ENABLED: enable/disable presence support - true or false
SRTP_KEY_EXCHANGE
SRTP_ENABLE: Whether or not voice communication are encrypted - True or False (Default: False)
SRTP_RTP_FALLBACK
TLS_LISTENER_PORT: TLS listening port (Default: 5061)
TLS_ENABLE: Whether or not signalling is encrypted - True or False (Default: False)
TLS_CA_LIST_FILE
TLS_CERTIFICATE_FILE
TLS_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE
TLS_METHOD
TLS_CIPHERS
TLS_SERVER_NAME
TLS_VERIFY_SERVER
TLS_VERIFY_CLIENT
TLS_REQUIRE_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE
TLS_NEGOTIATION_TIMEOUT_SEC

arg.name: details
arg.tp:docstring: Account.registrationCoarseStatus ( Coarse status like, UNREGISTERED or TRYING ) Account.registrationStatus ( Error code, like 200 (OK) or 408 (Timeout) ) Account.registrationStatusDescription ( A technical error message (from PJSIP) ) Account.lastSuccessfulRegister ( Timestamp of the last "REGISTERED" event ) Account.presenceStatus ( Published presence status ) Account.presenceNote ( Published presence note (status string) )

method.name: setAccountDetails
method.tp:docstring: Send new account parameters, or account parameters changes, to the core. The hash table is not required to be complete, only the updated parameters may be specified. Account settings are written to the configuration file when ring properly quits. After calling this method, the core will emit the signal accountDetailsChanged with the updated data. The client must subscribe to this signal and use it to update its internal data structure.

method.name: setAccountActive
method.tp:docstring: Set if this account is currently enabled (can be used). It is only a runtime proprety with no impact on the "enabled" state of the account.

tp:docstring.p: Set if enabled.

method.name: addAccount
method.tp:docstring: Add a new account. When created, the signal accountsChanged is emitted. The clients must then call getAccountList to update their internal data structure. If no details are specified, the default parameters are used. The core tries to register the account as soon it is created.

method.name: exportOnRing
method.tp:docstring: Export account on the DHT using the given password and generated PIN (returned through exportOnRingEnded signal).

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the operation was initialized successfully. exportOnRingEnded will be trigered on completion.

method.name: exportToFile
method.tp:docstring: Copy the account archive to the path provided in argument.

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the operation was initialized successfully.

signal.name: exportOnRingEnded
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when the exportOnRing operation ended.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring:
Status code: 0 for success
SUCCESS = 0 everything went fine. PIN is set.
WRONG_PASSWORD = 1 wrong password provided.
NETWORK_ERROR = 2 can't publish archive on the network.

arg.name: PIN
arg.tp:docstring: A PIN to show to the user to import the account from somewhere else.

method.name: revokeDevice
method.tp:docstring: Revoke device attached to the given Ring account, and publish the new revocation list.

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the operation was performed successfully.

signal.name: deviceRevocationEnded
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when the revokeDevice operation ended.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring:
Status code: 0 for success
SUCCESS = 0 everything went fine. Device is now revoked.
WRONG_PASSWORD = 1 revocation failed: wrong password.
UNKNOWN_DEVICE = 2 revocation failed: unknown device.

signal.name: accountProfileReceived
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a newly created account's profile is available for storage.

signal.name: knownDevicesChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a new device linked to this account is found.

arg.name: devices
arg.tp:docstring: A map of device IDs with corresponding labels.

method.name: getKnownRingDevices
method.tp:docstring: Gets list of known devices for this account.

arg.name: devices
arg.tp:docstring: A map of device IDs with corresponding labels.

method.name: changeAccountPassword
method.tp:docstring: Change the account archive password.

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the operation was successful.

method.name: lookupName
method.tp:docstring: Performs name lookup for the specified account (if any) or using the default nameserver.
method.arg: The account to use. If empty, use the default nameserver.
The name server URI to use, considered only if accountID is empty.

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the operation was initialized successfully. registeredNameFound will be trigered on completion.

method.name: lookupAddress
method.tp:docstring: Performs address lookup for the specified account (if any) or using the default nameserver.
method.arg: The account to use. If empty, use the default nameserver.
The name server URI to use, considered only if accountID is empty.

arg.name: address
arg.tp:docstring: Address to lookup for. Must not include spaces.

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the operation was initialized successfully. registeredNameFound will be trigered on completion. False in case of operation initialization error. registeredNameFound won't be called in that case.

signal.name: registeredNameFound
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a new registered address-name mapping is known. If status is not success (0), requested field (name or address) is left empty.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring:
Status code: 0 for success
SUCCESS = 0 everything went fine. Name/address pair was found.
INVALID_NAME = 1 provided name is not valid.
NOT_FOUND = 2 everything went fine. Name/address pair was not found.
ERROR = 3 An error happened

method.name: registerName
method.tp:docstring: Performs name registration with RingNS protocol for the specified account.

arg.name: name
arg.tp:docstring: Name to register. Must be lower-case ASCII, digits or "-" or "_".

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the operation was initialized successfully. nameRegistrationEnded will be trigered on completion. False in case of operation initialization error. nameRegistrationEnded won't be called in that case.

signal.name: nameRegistrationEnded
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when the registerName operation ended.

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring:
Status code: 0 for success
SUCCESS = 0 everything went fine. Name is now registered.
WRONG_PASSWORD = 1 registration failed: wrong password.
INVALID_NAME = 2 registration failed: invalid name.
ALREADY_TAKEN = 3 registration failed: name is already taken.
NETWORK_ERROR = 4 registration failed: network or server error.

arg.name: name
arg.tp:docstring: The name that was attempted to register.

method.name: searchUser
method.tp:docstring: Performs name registration with RingNS protocol for the specified account.

arg.name: query
arg.tp:docstring: Query to perform in the remote user directory. What properties are searched is server-dependant.

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the operation was initialized successfully and a corresponding signal will be triggered.

signal.name: userSearchEnded
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when the registerName operation ended.

arg.name: query
arg.tp:docstring: The query which is answered by this signal

method.name: setAccountsOrder
method.tp:docstring: Update the accounts order. When placing a call, the first registered account in the list is used.

arg.name: order
arg.tp:docstring: An ordered list of account IDs, delimited by '/'

method.name: removeAccount
method.tp:docstring: Remove an existing account. When removed, the signal accountsChanged is emitted. The clients must then call getAccountList to update their internal data structure.

arg.name: accoundID
arg.tp:docstring: The account to remove, identified by its ID

method.name: getAccountList
method.tp:docstring: Get a list of all created accounts, as stored by the core.

method.name: registerAllAccounts
method.tp:docstring: Send account registration (REGISTER) for all accounts, even if they are not enabled.

method.name: sendRegister
method.tp:docstring: Send account registration (REGISTER) to the registrar. Register the account if enable=true, unregister if enable=false.

tp:docstring.p: To register, enable must be true.
To un-register, enable must be false.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The message ID. An ID of 0 means that the message was not sent, likely because one of the parameters was invalid.

method.name: getNearbyPeers
method.tp:docstring: Get Discovered Peer Map

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring:
The message status.
UNKNOWN = 0 unknown message or message status
SENDING = 1 message is being sent or waiting for peer confirmation.
SENT = 2 message have been received from the other end.
READ = 3 message have been read by the peer.
FAILURE = 4 the message coudn't be delivered.

signal.name: incomingAccountMessage
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a new text message has been received at the account level.

signal.name: accountMessageStatusChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a sent text message status have changed

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: The new status of the message, see getMessageStatus for possible values.

signal.name: profileReceived
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a vCard has been received

tp:docstring.p: Sends and update composing indication for a given contact/conversation

arg.name: isComposing
arg.tp:docstring: True is the user is composing a message, false otherwise

tp:docstring.p: Informs that a message have been read

arg.name: success
arg.tp:docstring: True if the message status was set, false if account, contact or message is unknown.

signal.name: composingStatusChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a message composition status changed

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: The new status of the message, 0 for Idle, 1 for Active

tp:docstring.p: Sets the volume using a linear scale [0,100].
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: Pulseaudio has its own mechanism to modify application volume. This method is enabled only if the ALSA API is used.

tp:docstring.p: Return the volume value of the given device on a linear scale [0,100].
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: Only enabled if the ALSA API is used, Pulseaudio has its own mechanism to modify application volume.

tp:docstring.p: Notify clients of a volume level change.
This signal occurs only if ALSA is enabled since Pulseaudio streams are managed externally.

arg.name: mute
arg.tp:docstring: True to mute audio capture, false to unmute.

arg.name: muted
arg.tp:docstring: Returns true if audio capture is muted, false otherwise.

arg.name: mute
arg.tp:docstring: True to mute audio playback, false otherwise.

arg.name: muted
arg.tp:docstring: Returns true if audio playback is muted, false otherwise.

arg.name: mute
arg.tp:docstring: True to mute ringtone, false otherwise.

arg.name: muted
arg.tp:docstring: Returns true if ringtone is muted, false otherwise.

method.name: getSupportedAudioManagers
method.tp:docstring: Returns a list of compiled audio backends.

signal.name: hardwareDecodingChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Signal triggered when hardware decoding changes.

signal.name: hardwareEncodingChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Signal triggered when hardware encoding changes.

signal.name: audioDeviceEvent
signal.tp:docstring: Signal triggered by changes in the detected audio devices, e.g. a headset being unplugged.

method.name: isAudioMeterActive
method.tp:docstring: Gets whether or not an audio meter is active for id. If id is empty, returns whether or not there is at least one audio meter active.

arg.name: isActive
arg.tp:docstring: If the audio meter is active for the passed in id.

method.name: setAudioMeterState
method.tp:docstring: Sets whether or not the audio meter should be active for id. If id is empty, applies to all ring buffers.

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring: True to enabled the audio meter, false to disable.

signal.name: audioMeter
signal.tp:docstring: Signal containing volume level.

arg.name: level
arg.tp:docstring: RMS value for the volume. Conversion to dB can be done with dB=20*log10(level). Level is between 0 and 1.

arg.name: registrationDetail
arg.tp:docstring: The optional account-type specific message code. 0 when not available.

arg.name: registrationDetailStr
arg.tp:docstring: The optional account-type specific message string. Empty string when not available.

arg.name: details
arg.tp:docstring: Account.registrationCoarseStatus ( Coarse status like, UNREGISTERED or TRYING ) Account.registrationStatus ( Error code, like 200 (OK) or 408 (Timeout) ) Account.registrationStatusDescription ( A technical error message (from PJSIP) ) Account.lastSuccessfulRegister ( Timestamp of the last "REGISTERED" event ) Account.presenceStatus ( Published presence status ) Account.presenceNote ( Published presence note (status string) )

method.name: getSupportedCiphers
method.tp:docstring: Returns a list of supported encryption ciphers used to encrypt SIP messages. The list depends on the TLS library being used. Only registered SIP accounts currently support setting custom ciphers. This method returns an empty list if TLS support is disabled in either pjproject or Jami.

arg.name: accountID
arg.tp:docstring: A SIP account id, other account IDs will be rejected.

arg.name: list
arg.tp:docstring: A list of randomly sorted cipher names. The order may or may not be significant depending on the SSL library being used.

tp:docstring.p: A certificate ID

arg.name: details
arg.tp:docstring: A key-value list of all certificate validation The constants used as keys are defined in the "security.h" constants header file

tp:docstring.p: A certificate path.
An optional path a the private key for the certificate
An optional private key password
An optional path to an assumed valid ca list

arg.name: details
arg.tp:docstring: A key-value list of all certificate validation The constants used as keys are defined in the "security.h" constants header file

tp:docstring.p: A certificate ID

arg.name: details
arg.tp:docstring: A key-value list of all certificate details The constants used as keys are defined in the "security.h" constants header file

tp:docstring.p: A certificate path
An optional path a the private key for the certificate
An optional private key password

arg.name: details
arg.tp:docstring: A key-value list of all certificate details The constants used as keys are defined in the "security.h" constants header file

tp:docstring.p: A list of all known certificate IDs
A raw certificate (PEM or DER encoded) to be pinned.
True to save the certificate in the daemon local store.
IDs of the pinned certificate chain (from subject to issuer) or empty string on failure.
A certificate ID to unpin.
True if a certificate was unpinned.
A certificate path to be pinned (assumed non-local).
Certificates path.
Number of unpinned certificates.
An account ID
A certificate public key ID
True if the search started
An account ID
A certificate ID

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: The new status of the certificate for the specified account. UNDEFINED : forget any previous certificate state for this account. ALLOWED : consider the certificate as trusted for this account. BANNED : consider the certificate as banned for this account.

tp:docstring.p: True if the certificate state was successfully set.
An account ID

arg.name: status
arg.tp:docstring: The queried certificate status. ALLOWED : trusted certificate for this account. BANNED : banned certificate for this account.

arg.name: list
arg.tp:docstring: A list of certificate ids with the provided status

signal.name: certificateStateChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a certificate status have changed.

signal.name: certificatePinned
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a certificate have been added to the store.

signal.name: certificatePathPinned
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a certificate path have been added to the store.

signal.name: certificateExpired
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a certificate expired.

arg.name: requests
arg.tp:docstring: A list of contact request details. Details: - from: account ID of sender - received: UNIX timestamp of reception date - payload: attached payload

signal.name: incomingTrustRequest
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a new contact request has been received.

arg.name: ban
arg.tp:docstring: True if the the contact should be banned. If false, the contact is removed from the contact list (banned or not).

arg.name: contactDetails
arg.tp:docstring: The serialized details on given contact of given account.

arg.name: contacts
arg.tp:docstring: The list of contact information of given account.

signal.name: contactAdded
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a new contact has been added.

signal.name: contactRemoved
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a new contact has been removed.

method.name: monitor
method.tp:docstring: Monitor

method.name: startConversation
method.tp:docstring: Start a new conversation

method.name: acceptConversationRequest
method.tp:docstring: Accept a conversation's request

method.name: declineConversationRequest
method.tp:docstring: Decline a conversation's request

method.name: removeConversation
method.tp:docstring: Remove a conversation

method.name: getConversations
method.tp:docstring: Get the conversation list

method.name: getConversationRequests
method.tp:docstring: Get the conversation's requests list

method.name: updateConversationInfos
method.tp:docstring: Update conversation's infos (supported keys: title, description, avatar)

method.name: conversationInfos
method.tp:docstring: Get conversation's infos (mode, title, description, avatar)

method.name: addConversationMember
method.tp:docstring: Add a member to a conversation

method.name: removeConversationMember
method.tp:docstring: Remove a member from a conversation

method.name: getConversationMembers
method.tp:docstring: Get members of a conversation

method.name: sendMessage
method.tp:docstring: Add a message to a conversation

method.name: loadConversationMessages
method.tp:docstring: Load messages from a conversation

signal.name: mediaParametersChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients that a media parameter changed.

method.name: connectivityChanged
method.tp:docstring: This notifies the daemon that the network connectivity has changed, eg: - interface has disconnected from the network - interface connected to a different network - connected interface has changed (wifi to eth)

signal.name: migrationEnded
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when migration is ended.

arg.name: result
arg.tp:docstring: The result of the migration. SUCCESS : account migrated. INVALID : account migration failed.

signal.name: dataTransferEvent
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a data transfer state change.

signal.name: conversationLoaded
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a conversation is loaded

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: Id of the related loadConversationMessages's request

signal.name: messageReceived
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a conversation receives a new message

signal.name: conversationRequestReceived
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a new conversation request is received

signal.name: conversationReady
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a conversation is cloned and ready

signal.name: conversationRemoved
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a conversation is removed

signal.name: conversationMemberEvent
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when a member is invited/added/removed/banned

arg.name: member_uri
arg.tp:docstring: The URI of the member added

signal.name: onConversationError
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when an error occurs in a conversation

signal.name: debugMessageReceived
signal.tp:docstring: Notify clients when debug is outputted.

arg.name: message
arg.tp:docstring: The formatted message to be output.

signal.name: messageSend
signal.tp:docstring: Signal triggered when a log is done in the daemon.
